newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Radical Zaire opposition MP arrested - associates.
newsitem.headline: Radical Zaire opposition MP arrested - associates.

text.p: Zaire authorities have arrested a member of parliament close to radical opposition leader Etienne Tshisekedi, political associates said on Tuesday.
They said security forces firing in the air burst into a hall where Joseph Olenghankoy was addressing a news conference on Monday and took him away.

Governmemt spokesman Boguo Makeli said Olenghankoy had distributed tracts calling on Zaireans to rise up against Prime Minister Kengo wa Dendo, who is accused of doing little to counter a Tutsi rebellion in eastern Zaire.
"He should have been arrested long ago. He was distributing tracts while the country was at war," Boguo said.
Mukendi wa Mulumba, an aide of Tshisekedi said: "He is a member of parliament, he should have immunity from arrest."
Olenghankoy had called for dialogue with the Tutsi rebels.
Students backed by the radical opposition staged violent protests against Kengo's government two weeks ago, soon after rebels seized Zaire's two eastern provinces.
